reviewText: After playing this game for a while; it has it's good points and some very bad points. The basic overview of the game is that it is better than Demolition Company, in terms of building stability. For those who do not own Demoliton Company, it would suffice to say that sometimes you only need to walk into a building to cause parts of it to collapse; with this game that does not happen.\nIt is certainly not Construction Simulator 2015 as you are only constructing parts of a building rather than digging foundations, pouring concrete and delivering materials to the site as was pointed out in another review, this game utilises rubber band physics, a great indicator of this is with the mobile crane, the jib of the crane moves around which in turn causes the wire and hook to bounce around pretty much resulting in damage to materials.\nOverall I would say that the game warrants a 7/10 as there are some issues there which need dealt with. If any developers are reading this, a proper demolition simulator with the same physics as Construction Simulator 2015 would be fab. You could have all the hand tools needed plus excavators of various sizes and types such as high reach, or with a sorter head, claws, shears etc!!!!
voteText: 29 of 36 people (81%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This game is ok, but it needs a lot of fixes, some examples are as follows:

1. Vehicles slide way too easy, even when driving slow. even the Excavator slides around
2. several imaginary barriers, that you will bump into.
3. vehicle fuel usage set a little too fast.
3a. vehicles only have one speed, hint: (turtle power)
4. vehicle suspension does not function properly on rough terrain.
5. no customization availible for paint schemes. Just plain dull yellow.
6. A lot of repetitive effort on repeatables in order to purchase machines and upgrades.
All in all I am dissapointed in the game, and would not recommend it to a friend

reviewText: As much as I like the construction games. This is another that does not deliver well. It has some great promise. While I like the repairs the fuel is a bit excessive. A real vechile could go days with out a refueling. A 5 gallon gas can on any of this is not even worth the time. The some of the eq is fun to operate and most are most difficult. I was sad to see that you can not use a joystick nor game pad. This is not worth the money spent on it!

reviewText: As another reviewer pointed out, it's better than Demolition Company and that's really what I'd compare it to. It's more focused on the destruction / preparation of a work site than fully building. If you enjoy smashing and destroying things then I'm sure you'll find something to enjoy here. If you want to fully micromanage all aspects of a construction company then this one will leave you feeling empty. The destruction physics feel satisifying and there's a decent selection of vehicles and tasks to keep you busy.\n\nhttps://youtu.be/iCnv7S1UqtE

reviewText:
Edit: So I have played a little more after my first impressions. About 90 minutes into the game I have had two crashes which resulted in Blue Screens of Death. A unique experience to say the least these days. Controls are frustrating as well. I would stay away until the game at the very least is stable and on sale. $10 would be a more realistic price point IMO.

So far it has been an interesting take on the construction simulator games. Very enjoyable to smash down buildings and seems to have a unique variety of missions however do not expect AAA graphics or anything of the sort. Fun game so far.

Will edit after I have played more.

reviewText: I liked the game, but was shocked when there were only like 7 or 8 machines & only around 25 different scenerios in the ENTIRE game...wish it had a few more machines & scenerios for sure.
as i jump from fs 2015 to this i could see why a lot of people thought it was bugs but over i enjoy the game and hope to play it more

The simulation  was fun but short lived less than 20 hours to complete all equipment upgrades and end scenerio. The number of construction vehicles is less than demonstrated on the film clips of the game. Game clips showed construction of a high rise apartment building but such construction was not part of the game play. Very misleading. The physics is acceptable but far from perfect. When you decide to go  to free play, all you get is a rehash of the different scenerios already played. Dissapointing. Although I rated this game as recommended, the real recommendation is mixed.
